   <tei-pb n="24" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
   <tei-head data-origname="head">Monſieur Acarete du Biscay's Journey from Buenos Ayres to Peru</tei-head>
    <tei-p data-origname="p">
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>I Left <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>, and took the Road I  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> to <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Cordoua</tei-name>, leaving <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Santa Fe</tei-name> on my <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> right hand, of which place take this ac- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>count, 'tis a Spaniſh Settlement dependant <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>upon <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>, the Commander is  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>no more than a Lieutenant, and does no- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>thing but by order from the Governor  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>. 'Tis a little place con- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>taining 25 <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">Houfes</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Houses</tei-reg> </tei-choice>, without any Walls,  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Fortifications, or Garriſon, diſtant 80 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Leagues from <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name> Northward, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Situate upon the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River de la Plata</tei-name>, large <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Veſſels might come up to it, were it not <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>for a great bank that obstructs the pas- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>sage a little above <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>. Ne- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>vertheleſs 'tis a very advantageous Poſt, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>because 'tis the only passage from <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Peru</tei-name>, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Chili</tei-name> and <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Tucuman</tei-name> to <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Paraguay</tei-name>, and in a <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>manner the Magazine of the Commodi-
 </tei-p>

<tei-pb n="25" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
      <tei-p data-origname="p">
 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ties drawn from thence, particularly that <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Herb already <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſpoken</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">spoken</tei-reg> </tei-choice> of, which they <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>cannot be without in thoſe Provinces. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>The Soil is as good and Fertile here as <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>at <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name> ; and the Town having <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>nothing remarkably different from what <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>has been <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">observ'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">observed</tei-reg> </tei-choice> of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>, I <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>leave it, and proceed upon my Jour- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ney. 'Tis counted 140 Leagues from <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name> to <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Cordoua</tei-name>, and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">becauſe</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">because</tei-reg> </tei-choice> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ſome parts of the Road are uninhabited  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>for a long way together; I ſurnished my <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">felf</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">self</tei-reg> </tei-choice> at <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>my departure with what I <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>was inform'd I <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">fhould</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">should</tei-reg> </tei-choice> <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">ftand</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">stand</tei-reg> </tei-choice> in need <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of; ſo I ſet out having a Savage for my <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Guide, with Three <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">Hofes</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Horses</tei-reg> </tei-choice> and Three <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Mules, ſome to carry my Baggage, and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>the <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">reft</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">rest</tei-reg> </tei-choice> to change upon the way when <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that I rid upon was tired. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>From <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>, to the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River Lu <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>can</tei-name>, and even as far as the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River Recife</tei-name>, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>30 Leagues, I pass’d by several Habita <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tions and Farms cultivated by the Spani- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ards, but beyond Recife to the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Salladillo</tei-name>, I <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">faw</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">saw</tei-reg> </tei-choice> none. Let it be obſer- <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ved by the way, that theſe Rivers as well <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>as all the reſt in the Provinces of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Ayres</tei-name>, <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Paraguay</tei-name> and <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Tucuman</tei-name>, that fall <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>into the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River de la Plata</tei-name> are fordable <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>on <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">horfe</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">horse
</tei-reg> </tei-choice> -back; but when the Rains or <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">any</tei-fw>
   </tei-p>

<tei-pb n="26" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
   <tei-p data-origname="p">
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>other accident <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſwells</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">swells</tei-reg> </tei-choice> them, a <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Traveller <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">muſt</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">must</tei-reg></tei-choice> either <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſwim</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">swim</tei-reg></tei-choice> over, or <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">elſe</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">else</tei-reg></tei-choice> get <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>upon a bundle in the nature of a raft, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>which a Savage hawls over to the other <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſide</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">side</tei-reg></tei-choice>. I could not Swim, and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſo</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">so</tei-reg></tei-choice> was <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>forc'd to make <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">uſe</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">use</tei-reg></tei-choice> of this expedient <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>twice or thrice when I could not find a <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Ford. The way was this, my <!--<emph style="font-style: italic">Indian</emph>--> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>kill'd a Wild Bull, flead the Hide off, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſtuffed</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">stuffed</tei-reg></tei-choice> it with <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſtraw</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">straw</tei-reg></tei-choice>, and ty'd it up in <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>a great bundle with thongs of the <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſame</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">same</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Hide, upon which I plac'd my <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſelf</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">self</tei-reg></tei-choice> with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> my Baggage ; he <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſwam</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">swam</tei-reg></tei-choice> over hawling me <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>after him by a Cord ty'd to the bundle, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and then he repaſs'd and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſwam</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">swam</tei-reg></tei-choice> my <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Horſes</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Horses</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and Mules over to me.</tei-p>
   
   <tei-p data-origname="p">
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>All the Country between the <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">River <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Recife</tei-name> and <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Salladillo</tei-name>, tho' uninhabited, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>abounds in Cattle and all ſorts of Fruit <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>trees, except Walnut and Chesnut-trees; <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>there are whole Woods of Nectarine-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Trees, Three or Four Leagues in <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">compaſs</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">compass</tei-reg></tei-choice>, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that bear excellent Fruit, which they <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>not only eat raw, but bake them, or dry <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>them in the Sun, to keep, as we in <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">France</tei-name> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> do Prunes: They <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ſeldom uſe</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">seldom use</tei-reg></tei-choice> any other <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>than the Wood of this Tree for common <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>firing at <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Ayres</tei-name>, and thereabouts. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>The Savages that dwell in <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">theſe</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">these</tei-reg></tei-choice> Parts are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">diſtinguiſh'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">distinguished</tei-reg></tei-choice> into two sorts, those that <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">voluntarily</tei-fw></tei-p>

ſubmit to the Spaniards are call’d Panpiſtas, the reſt Serranos, both cloathed with Skins, but the laſt ſet up on the Panpiſtas as their mortal Enemies wherever they meet with them. All Fight on Horſe-back, either with Lances pointed with Iron or Bones ſharpen'd, or else with Bows and Arrows, they wear Bulls-hides faſhion'd like a Doublet without ſleeves, to defend their Bodies. Their Chiefs that command over them in War and Peace, are call’d Couracas. When they take any one of their Enemies, alive or dead, they meet all together, and after they have reproach'd him, that either he or his Relations were the death of their Kindred or Friends, they cut and tear him into pieces, which they roaſt a little and eat, making a drinking Bowl of his Scull. They feed moſtly upon flesh either raw or dreſs'd, and particularly Colts fleſh, which they like! better than Veal. They catch abundance of Fiſh likewiſe in their Rivers, They have no ſettled places of aboad, but ramble up and down, ſeveral Families together, and live in Tents. 
I could not inform my ſelf exactly what Religion they were of, but I was told that they look'd upon the Sun and Moon as Deities and as I travell'd along, I ſaw a Savage upon his knees with his Face to the Sun, who cry'd out and made ſtrange geſtures with his Hands and Arms. I learn'd from the Savage that accompany'd me, that he was one of thoſe they call'd Papas, who in the Morning kneel towards the Sun, and at Night towards the Moon, to ſupplicate those fancy'd Divinities to be propitious to them, to give them fair Weather, and Victory over their Foes. 
They make no great Ceremony in their Marriages ; but when a Relation dies, after they have rubb’d his body with a certain Earth that conſumes all but the Bones, they preserve them, and carry as many of them as they can conveniently about with them in a ſort of Cheſts, and this they do in token of their affection to their Kindred ; indeed they are not wanting in good Offices to them during their Lives, nor in their Sickneſs and Death. 
Along the River Salladillo, I took notice of a great many Parrats, or Papagays, as the Spaniards call them, and certain Birds, call’d Guacamayos, which are of divers Colours, and twice or thrice as big as a Parrat. The River it ſelf is full of the Fiſh, call'd Dorado, which is very good to eat. There is alſo a Creature in it, whether 'tis Meat or Poyſon no body knows, it has Four Feet and a long Tail like a Lizard. 
From Salladillo quite to Cordoua, you go along a very fine River, that abounds with Fiſh, which is neither wide nor deep, for it may be forded over. On the Bank of it you meet with little Plan tations every Three or Four Leagues ; which are like Country Houſes inhabited by Spaniards, Portuguese, and the Natives, who have all the neceſſary accomodations of Life they can wiſh, and are very Civil and Charitable to Strangers; their principal Wealth is in Horſes and Mules, in which they Trade with the Inhabitants of Peru. 
Cordoua is a Town Situate in a pleaſant and fruitful Plain upon the ſide of a River, bigger and broader than that I have juſt ſpoken of : 'Tis compos’d of about 400 Houses, Built like thoſe of Buenos Ayres. It has neither Ditches, nor Walls, nor Fort for its defence; He that Commands it is Governor of all the Provinces of Tucuman, and tho’ it be the place of his ordinary Residence, yet he is wont now and then, as he ſees occaſion, to go and paſs ſome time at St. Jago de l’Eſtro, at St. Miguel de Tucuman, (which is the Capital City of the Province) at Salta and at Xuxui. In each of theſe Villages there is a Lieutenant, who has under him an Alcalde and ſome Officers for the Adminiſtration of Juſtice. The Biſhop of Tucuman likewiſe uſually reſides at Cordoua, where the Cathedral is the only Pariſh Church of the whole Town, but there are divers Convents of Monks, namely of Dominicans, Recollects, and those of the Order de la Mercy: and one of Nunns. The Jesuits have a College there, and their Chappel is the fineſt and richeſt of all. 
The Inhabitants are Rich in Gold and Silver, which they get by the Trade they have for Mules, with which they furniſh Peru and other Parts; which is ſo conſiderable, that they ſell about 28 or 30000 of 'em every Year, which they breed up in their Farms. They usually keep 'em till they are about Two Years old, then expose 'em to Sale, and have about Six Patagons a piece for 'em. The Merchants that come to buy 'em, carry 'em to St. Jago, to Salta and Xuxui , where they leave 'em for Three Years, till they are well grown and become ſtrong, and afterwards bring 'em to Peru, where they preſently have Vent for 'em, becauſe there as well as in the reſt of the Western part of America, the greateſt part of their Carriage is upon Mules. The People of Cordoua alſo drive a Trade in Cows, which they have from the Countrey of Buenos Ayres, and carry to Peru, where without this way of Subſiſtance 'tis certain they would have much ado to live. This kind of Traffick makes this Town the moſt conſiderable in the Province of Tucuman, as well for its Riches and Commodities, as for the Number of its Inhabitants, which are counted to be at leaſt 5 or 600 Families, beſides Slaves who are three times the number. But the gene rality of 'em of all degrees have no other Arms but a Sword and Poignard, and are very indifferent Souldiers, the Air of the Country, and the Plenty they enjoy, rendring them Lazy and Cowardly. 



 
</tei-body>
</tei-text>

 <tei-text data-origname="text">
   <tei-body data-origname="body">
   <tei-pb n="22" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
   <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">LA REVISTA DE BUENOS AIRES</tei-fw>
   <tei-head data-origname="head">Viaje de Monsíeur Acárete du Biscay desde Buenos Aires hasta el Perú</tei-head>

         </tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Los salvajes que moran en estos lugares, se dividen en<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> dos clases; aquellos que se someten voluntariamente <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> los<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> españoles, llámaseles Pampistas, y los demás Serranos.          <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> la de ternera. Toman en los nos pescado en abundancia<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> y no tienen morada fija, sino que vagan de un lado <tei-choice data-origname="choice"> <tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> otro<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> con sus familias, viviendo en toldos.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
         </tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">No pude averiguar con exactitud de qué religión eran, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>pero dijéronme que tenian al sol y la luna por deidades, y<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> mi paso vi un salvaje arrodillado con la cara hacia el sol,<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> que daba gritos y accionaba de un modo estraño con los<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> brazos y las manos. Supe por el salvaje que me acompaña<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ba, que era uno de aquellos<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> quienes llaman Papas, quie<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>nes por la mañana se arrodillan mirando al sol y en la no<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>che á la luna, para suplicar á aquellas supuestas divinidades<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> que les sean propicias, que les conceda buen tiempo y la<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> victoria sobre sus enemigos.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">No son de gran aparato las ceremonias en sus casa<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>mientos; pero cuando muere un pariente, después de haber<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> dado friegas al cuerpo con cierta tierra que todo lo consu<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>me menos los huesos, conservan estos, llevando consigo<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> cuantos pueden en una especie de cajones, y esto lo hacen<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> en prueba de afecto<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> sus deudos; y en verdad no faltan en<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> sus buenos oficios <tei-orig data-origname="orig">hácia</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">hacia</tei-reg>  ellos durante sus vidas, ni aun en<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> sus enfermedades y en su muerte.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Por la costa del <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Saladillo</tei-name> observé gran número de loros,<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> según les llaman los españoles, papagallos, y ciertos pá<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>jaros llamados guacamayos, que son de diversos colores y<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> dos<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ó</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">o</tei-reg></tei-choice> tres veces <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> grandes que un loro. El <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">rio</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">río</tei-reg></tei-choice>está lleno<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> del pescado que llaman dorado. También hállase en él un<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> animal de cuatro patas y con cola como un lagarto, pero si<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> es bueno como alimento,<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ó</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">o</tei-reg></tei-choice> nocivo, nadie lo sabe.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Del <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Saladillo</tei-name> hasta <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Córdoba</tei-name>, se sigue costeando un her<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>moso <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">rio</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">río</tei-reg></tei-choice>, que abunda en pescado, y que no es ni ancho ni<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> profundo, pudiéndose vadearlo. Sobre las barrancas de él<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> 
<tei-pb n="26" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
   <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">LA REVISTA DE BUENOS AIRES</tei-fw>
         encuéntranse haciendas<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> cada tres<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ó</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">o</tei-reg></tei-choice> cuatro leguas, que son<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> como casas de campo, habitadas por españoles, portugue<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ses é hijos del país en donde tienen todas las comodidades<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> de la vida que pueden apetecer, y son muy corteses y car<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>itativos para con los estraños. Su principal riqueza con<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>siste en caballos y mulas, con los que trafican con los ha<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>bitantes de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Perú</tei-name>.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p"><tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Córdoba</tei-name> es un pueblo situado en una llanura agradable<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> y feraz,<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> la margen de un <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">rio</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">río</tei-reg></tei-choice><tei-orig data-origname="orig">as</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg> grande y <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> ancho que<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> el de que acabo de hablar. Se compone como de 400 ca<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>sas construidas como las de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Aires</tei-name>. No tienen fosos,<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
         murallas ni fortaleza para su defensa. El que manda alli es<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> Gobernador de todas las provincias de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Tucuman</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Tucumán</tei-reg></tei-choice></tei-name>, y aun<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> cuando este es el lugar de su residencia ordinaria, sin em<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>bargo, acostumbra de vez en cuando, según lo cree conve<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>niente, ir<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> pasar algún tiempo en <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Santiago de Estero</tei-name>, en<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
         San Miguel de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Tucuman</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Tucumán</tei-reg></tei-choice></tei-name> (que es la ciudad capital de la Pro<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>vincia) en <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Salta</tei-name><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">ó</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">o</tei-reg></tei-choice> en <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Xuxui</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Jujuy</tei-reg></tei-choice></tei-name>. En cada uno de estos pueblitos<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> existe un teniente, que tiene bajo sus órdenes un Alcalde y<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> algunos oficiales para la administración de justicia. El<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> obispo de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Tucuman</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Tucumán</tei-reg></tei-choice></tei-name> también reside ordinariamente en <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Cór<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>doba</tei-name>, en donde la Catedral es la única iglesia parroquial<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> que hay en todo el pueblo; pero hay varios conventos de<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> frailes,<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> saber, de Dominicos, Recoletos, y de la Orden de<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> la Merced; y uno de monjas. Los Jesuítas tienen alli un<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> colegio, y su Capilla es la <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> rica y <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> hermosa de todas.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Los habitantes son ricos en oro y plata, adquiridos por<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> el comercio que hacen de mulas, supliendo de ellas al <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Perú</tei-name><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> y otros puntos; y es tan considerable éste que venden de 28<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
        <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> 30,000 al año, que crian en sus haciendas. Generalmente<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> las conservan hasta que tienen dos años poniéndolas en<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
  <tei-pb n="27" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
   <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">UN LIBRO CURIOSO Y RARO</tei-fw>
         tonces<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> venta, obteniendo por ellas<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> razón como de seis<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> patacones por cada una. Los mercaderes que vienen á<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> comprarlas las llevan<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Santiago</tei-name>,<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Salta</tei-name> y<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Xuxui</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Jujuy</tei-reg></tei-choice></tei-name>, donde<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> las conservan tres años hasta que se hayan creado y robus<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tecido bien, llevándolas después al <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Perú</tei-name>, en donde las ven<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>den sin demora, porque alli, como en el resto de la <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">América</tei-name><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> occidental, la mayor parte de las conducciones se hacen á<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> lomo de mula.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Las gentes de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Córdoba</tei-name> trafican también en vacas que<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> conducen desde los campos de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Buenos Aires</tei-name> hasta el <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Perú</tei-name>,<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> en donde, sin este medio de subsistencia, ciertamente les<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> seria muy difícil vivir. Este negocio hace que este pueblo<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
         sea el <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> considerable de los de la Provincia de <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type"><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">Tucuman<tei-orig data-origname="orig"> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">Tucumán</tei-reg>,<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> tanto por sus riquezas y artículos de comercio, cuanto por<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> el número de sus habitantes, que se calculan entre quinien<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tas<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> seiscientas familias, ademas de los esclavos, que mon<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tan<tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">á</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">a</tei-reg></tei-choice> tres tantos <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice>.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
         <tei-p data-origname="p">Pero las clases todas, en general, no tienen <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">mas</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">más</tei-reg></tei-choice> arma que<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> espada y puñal, y como soldados son de muy escaso méri<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>to, pues el aire del país y la abundancia de que gozan, los<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/> hace holgazines y cobardes.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/></tei-p>
         
     
 
</tei-orig></tei-orig></tei-choice></tei-name></tei-p></tei-choice></tei-p></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text></tei-TEI>
